result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian E Olds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brian E Olds in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Brian E Olds in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:18 AM. Called 13CF124, 14CF03, 15CM100, 16CF63 and 16CF64. State - here for sentencing after revocation on 14CF03 and 13CF124 and here for sentencing hearing on 15CM100, 16CF63 and 16CF64. Voorhees and Olds have revocation summary packet and does not see any inaccuracies. Court notes that the revocation summary is recommending a lengthy term of incarceration - preferrably in prison. Court needs moment to review charges (11:24 AM). State has complied with victim notification requirements with no response. State - summarizes the defendant's criminal history prior to final argument for sentencing - 13CF124 - recommends #1 - 8 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 4 years of initial confinement followed by 4 years of ES, #2 - 3.5 in WI State Prison System consisting of 1.5 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES - concurrent to count #1; 14CF03 - #3 - 6 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES - concurrent to 13CF124; 15CM100 - 90 days jail on each count - concurrent to each other and to 13CF124; 16CF63 - counts #1 and #2 - 3.5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1.5 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES - concurrent to each other but consecutive to 14CF03 and 13CF124; 16CF64 - #2 - 2 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1 year of initial confinement followed by 1 year of ES - consecutive to 13CF124, and on counts #3, #5 and #10 - 9 months on each count concurrent to each and to 16CF63 but consecutive to 14CF03 and 13CF124, asking that any restitution/costs be paid by garnishing any of his prison wages/income that he is entitled to. Voorhees makes final argument prior to sentencing recommendation - 13CF124 - calculates jail credit of 444 days  - asking court to consider time served on this case and asks Court to structure any more incarceration time on the new cases, not the revocation cases, calculates 226 days credit on 14CF03 (State stiplulates to defense counsels representation of the facts in 16CF64 and no need to play video - Court agrees) - asking court to not order sex offender registration for stated reasons - recommends a modest period of confinement time and consider consecutive probation on 16CF63 case and an imposed and stayed sentence. Olds makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: Recess until 1:00 PM. Recalled at 1:08 with same appearances. Voorhees makes additional statement in regards to sentences - State is recommending a consecutive prison sentence on the three cases that are being sentenced today. Court comes up with 5.5 years in prison and 6 years of ES, believes that 136CF124, 14CF03 and 15CM100 are concurrent and 16CF63 and 16CF64 are concurrent to each other but consecutive to 13CF124. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 13CF124 - count #1 - 6 years in WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES, count #2 - 3.5 with 1.5 in and 2 out - concurrent to count #1; 14CF03 - 6 years with 3 in and 3 out - concurrent to counts #1 and #2 on 13CF124; 15CM100 - #3 - 9 months in FC jail and #4 - 9 months in jail - concurrent to each other and to time on 14CF03 and 13CF124; 16CF63 - count #1 - 3.5 years with 1.5 in and 2 out - consecutive to time on 13CF124 and 14CF03 and 15CM100, #2 - 3.5 years with 1.5 in and 2 out - concurrent to count #1; 16CF64 - count #2 - 2 years with 1 in and 1 out - concurrent to time on 16CF63, counts #3, #5 and #10 - 9 months on each count - concurrent to count #1 and concurrent to counts #1 and #2 on 16CF63 and to 13CF124, 14CF03 and 15CM100; any unpaid fines to be paid as condition of ES with other conditions of ES on other counts include:costs - paid thru 25% of any wages/funds he is entitled to, no consumption of alcohol, restitution if submitted, credit for 444 days on 13CF124 (stipulated) - also same credit given on 14CF03 and 15CM100, not eligible for programs, finds crime was sexually motivated but not ordering sex offender registration (16CF63), submit DNA sample with expungement rights given, no possession of firearms, no voting rights. Voorhees believes the defendant is entitled to 226 days credit on 14CF03. Court reviews. Stgate will stipulate to credit as stated by Voorhees. Court - 14CF03 - 226 days credit (stipulated), right to appeal, adjourned at 1:46 PM.
State's Settlement Recommendation
Sentencing hearing on July 7, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Brian E Olds in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Brian E Olds in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:18 PM. Called 15CM100, 16CF64, 16CF63, 14CF03, 16CF102, 16CF123 and 13CF124. State - makes statement in regards to setting matters for a sentencing hearing and only taking a plea today due victim notification requirements on case #'s 15CM100, 16CF23 and 16CF24; on 15CM100  - plead to counts #3 and #4 - 90 days jail on each count concurrent to each other and concurrent to any jail sentence he may receive on 16CF64 and 16CF63; 16CF63 - on both counts #1 and #2 - dismiss repeater enchancer, plead G to #1 and #2 after amended and DRI counts #3 and #4 - free to argue sentence; 16CF64 - plead to counts #2, #3, #5, #10, s alleged and remaining counts to be DRI - free to argue sentence. Voorhees and Olds agree and agree with the free to argue sentence. Court  - 16CF64 - DRI counts #1, #4, #6, #7, #8, #9, #11 and #12. Olds pleads NC to counts #2, #3, #5, and #10. Simono states that all felonies counts must have a G plea to them. Voorhees does recall that agreement and states that the defendant will plead G to those counts as previously stated (#2, #3, #5,  and #10). Court - 16CF63 - DRI #3 and #4, amend count #1 to delete any repeater enhancements/allegation. Olds pleads G to count #1 as amended; 16CF63 - amends #2 to delete repeater enhancer. Olds pleads G to count #2 as amended. Court - 15CM100 - DRI counts #1 and #2, Olds plead G to counts #3 and #4 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire for 15CM100, 16CF63 and 16CF64, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts pleas, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. Voorhees makes statement in regards to setting the matter for sentencing hearing, talks about victim notification requirements and sex offender registry component. Court responds, not committing itself either way on what he will order at sentencing. Neither party are asking for a PSI. Court not going to order PSI either. Court continues bond on these matters and sets all matters for SEH on 7/7/16 at 11:00 AM, backing up a JT. All matters will be set on same date and time.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Plea hearing on June 22, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial on July 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian E Olds in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 4:27 AM. Called 15CM100, 16CF64 and 16CF63. Voorhees informs the Court that they are not ready to proceed to today. State states recommendation - 16CF63 and 16CF64 - global offer on 16CF63 - plead G to counts #1 and #2 as alleged, 16CF64 - plead G to count #2 as alleged and #3 and #5 as alleged, count #9 and #10 and #11 and #12, plead to and remaining counts DRI. 15CM100 plead to counts #3 and #4 with 90 days jail, concurrent to each other plus costs and dismiss and read in counts #1 and #2. Voorhees makes statement, informing Court that the offer is not really being rejected, just have not had time to discuss it with the defendant, just asking for an adjourment. Court not allowing adjournment, goes thru verbal collaquey for rejecting a plea, set matters for JT. Olds makes statement. Court will set 16CF64 and 15CM100 for JT on 7/14/16 and 16CF63 on 8/11/16, court continues bond. Voorhees would not be asking for alot of extra time on the sentencing after revocation, would still like a global resolution. Court denies that request.   Jury trial scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on May 23, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Brian E Olds, in custody, in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:37 PM. Called 16CF63, 16CF64 and 15CM100. State - here for PH on felony matters and status conference on 15CM100, believes waiver will be filed on the CF files, State has filed INFO, 16CF63 does not mirror. Voorhees hands court waiver of PH form, court goes over form with defendant and finds he is waiving his right to PH freely, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial on both 16CF63 and 16CF64. Voorhees would like to proceed with ARGN, has INFO in each case, 16CF63 waives further reading and enters NG pleas and 16CF64 waives further reading of new INFO and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas on all counts in both cases.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 01:00 pm on all cases.
defense
Status conference on March 24, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Brian E Olds,in custody and appears via video from FC jail with attorney John E Voorhees appearing in court. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:15 PM. Called 15CM100, 16CF63 & 16CF64. State believes for felony matters here for INIT - Believes misd. case defendant was originally represtented by Michael Rielly. Voorhees makes statement in regards to representing defendant in the misd. case. Olds does not object to Voorhees handling all cases. Court - accepts oral representation and Voorhees does not have to do an order for substitution of counsel. Voorhees has reviewed complaints on all three cases with Olds. Voorhees requests PH and would like to review bond, indicates Olds is on probation hold and awaiting a revocation hearing (13CF124 & 14CF03). Voorhees asks for minimal cash bond for stated reasons. State - asks for bond to continue for stated reasons. Court will continue bond on each case, at this point.  Voorhees would like PH and waives time limits. Schedule PH 3/24 at 2:45. 15CM100 to be scheduled for STC. Status conference scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Brian E Olds
Current: 11049 Daisy Lane, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 03-09-2016)
Prior: 102 West Washington Street, Crandon, WI 54520

Defendant Brian E Olds in custody and appears via video from FOSO with Attorney Chad Lynch appearing in court, specially today for John Voorhees  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:42 AM. Olds or Lynch do not have complaints. Court reads charges and penalties. Olds and Lynch understand charges and penalties, waives further reading, requests PH and check with Voorhees in regards to scheduling the matters for a PH at this time. State asks that bonds continue at this point. Lynch - bond - would like the cases called this afternoon when Voorhees is here. Court - bond - 15CM100 - $1000 cash.
Return on warrant at 03-09-2016 01:00 pm
Arrested FOSO.

Attorney Michael John Rielly in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:04 PM. Rielly not sure where the defendant is, tried contacting him via phone and phone does not ring. Court issues bench warrant, body or $1,000.00.
Final pre-trial at 09-23-2015 02:00 pm

Defendant Brian E Olds in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:16 PM. Olds and Rielly have complaint, reviews it with the defendant. Court reads charges and penalties. Olds and Rielly understand charges and penalties. Rielly waives further reading, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Initial appearance at 08-06-2015 02:15 pm
No consumption of alcohol.
